snippet: New York's governor is backing a new and controversial strategy for reducing the number of new infections in the state.
abstract: The Upshot; New York Gov Andrew M Cuomo announces strategy of ending state's AIDS epidemic, with goal of seeing only 750 new infections by 2020; drug Truvada is one part of three-pronged approach; other two strategies, getting more people tested and seen by doctors, along with getting HIV-positive people to stay on medication, have been used by New York and other states with some success.
lead_paragraph: New York's governor is backing a new and controversial strategy for reducing the number of new infections in the state.

headline.main: Pill to Prevent H.I.V. Gets a Prominent Backer: Andrew Cuomo
headline.print_headline: With Cuomo’s Plan to Fight AIDS, New Approach Gains a Prominent Backer
